full_description:
Apple Mac Studio M2 Max chip 12-core CPU 32GB Memory 512GB SSD (MQH73)

The small Apple Mac Studio, powered by the M2 Max 12-core CPU, enables creative professionals to tackle practically any project, from editing their first video to creating a feature-length film. This machine, which has 32GB of Unified memory, a 30-core GPU, and a 512GB SSD, can support up to 10 streams of 8K ProRes video playback as well as hardware-accelerated H.264, HEVC, and ProRes RAW encoding and decoding. The Apple M2 Max has 67 billion transistors, which is 10 billion more than the M1 Max and more than three times the number found in the M2. It merges the CPU, GPU, Neural Engine, I/O, and other components into a single system on a chip (SoC). The Apple M2 Max, built with 2nd-Gen 5nm manufacturing technology, provides the necessary performance without sacrificing power efficiency. The 12-core CPU includes eight performance cores and four high-efficiency cores. The 16-core Neural Engine enables on-device machine learning acceleration.

Apple M2 Ultra with 24‑core CPU; 60‑core GPU; 32‑core Neural Engine
full_description:
Apple Mac Studio M2 Ultra chip 24-core CPU 64GB Memory 1TB SSD (MQH63X/A)

The Apple Mac Studio, powered by the advanced M2 Ultra 24-core CPU, is a powerhouse for creative professionals demanding peak performance. With 64GB of Unified RAM, a 60-core GPU, and a large 1TB SSD, this small machine is ideal for activities ranging from music composition to 8K video editing.

M2 Ultra Processor

The M2 Ultra processor is a technical marvel made up of two M2 Max dies joined using Ultra Fusion, Apple's proprietary packaging technique. This architecture allows for nearly 2.5 TB/s of low latency interprocessor communication, letting the M2 Ultra seem as a single chip in software. This seamless connection offers maximum performance without needing code rewrites.

macOS and Pro Apps Optimization

macOS is designed to grow with Apple hardware, so it instantly takes use of the M2 Max's improved graphics, enough memory, and excellent machine learning capabilities. This improvement applies to a wide range of professional applications, such as Final Cut Pro, Adobe Photoshop, DaVinci Resolve Studio, Compressor, Autodesk Maya, Xcode, and others.

Powerful Connections for Versatility

The Apple Mac Studio has a wide set of 12 high-performance ports for optimum flexibility. These include an SDXC card reader, an HDMI connector that supports up to 8K resolution monitors, Thunderbolt 4 connections for more displays, Bluetooth 5.3, Wi-Fi 6E, a 10 Gb Ethernet socket, USB-A ports, and a 3.5mm audio jack. Seamless syncing with other Apple devices expands connectivity possibilities.

Studio Display & Mac Studio

The Apple Mac Studio Display, designed to accompany the Mac Studio, has a 27-inch 5K Retina display, a 12MP Ultra-Wide camera with Center Stage, a studio-quality three-mic array, and a six-speaker sound system with Spatial Audio. They work together to offer the ideal studio setup, with the ability to connect to up to eight screens at once.

Cool and Quiet Operation

Despite its impressive features, the Mac Studio stays cool and silent throughout demanding work owing to an effective cooling system. Whisper-quiet fans keep users focused on their work even amid high workloads. Furthermore, the Mac Studio has an ecologically aware design that incorporates 100 percent recycled materials in crucial components.

Environmental Responsibility

The Apple Mac Studio was designed with sustainability in mind, and its magnets and solder on the main logic board are made entirely of recycled materials. The packaging is carefully constructed, helping to create a more environmentally friendly supply chain. This focus on reducing environmental effects exemplifies Apple's attention to environmentally responsible practices.
